content.html:
Activity

Each of the scatter plots shows a strong relationship. Write a sentence or two describing how you think the variables are related.

1. During the month of April, Elena keeps track of the number of inches of rain recorded for the day and the percentage of people who come to school with rain jackets.


Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

When there is more rain, it is more likely people will wear jackets.


2. A school book club has a list of 100 books for its members to read. They keep track of the number of pages in the books the members read from the list and the amount of time it took to read the book.


Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

Longer books will take more time to read.


3. Number of tickets left for holiday parties at a venue and noise level at the party


Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

When more tickets are left, the party will have fewer people to have loud conversations, so it will be quieter.


4. The height and score on a test of vocabulary for several children ages 6 to 13


Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

Children who are taller are usually older, so they have had more time to be in school and learn more vocabulary.
